events.name: How Animation & Digital Effects tools powers 3D Visualisations
events.description:
This event is free and open to the public. Library books will be available for browsing and borrowing during the event.
Programme Details
Transforming your ideas into engaging visual story have never been easier with 3D and digital media software available today. Two industry professionals, Dion and Ming, will share some valuable insights about how they have achieved this in some of their projects.  

This session is particularly interesting to those who are searching for new ways to engage and emotionally connect with your audience.
There will also be a Q&A session after the talk.
Speaker Profile
 
Min Yu: Min Yu has worked in the film & video industry for almost 10 years.   He started as a broadcast graphics designer at The Moving Visuals Co. before moving on to companies like Emoxis and Abundant Productions.   Currently, he leads the creative team at Little Red Ants Creative Studio. He has been involved in client works ranging from agency works to channel promos, broadcast titles, tvcs, short films and "run of the mill" corporate videos for both the government and private sector.   He would like to share his work experience on different production processes and workflows.
 
Dion: Dion, a graduate of the NTU School of Art, Design and Media, is an Art Director and 3D Designer based in Singapore.  He had worked on creative projects with local companies such as CRITICA TV and Abundant Productions before starting his own studio, One Hour Gallery.   Clients that he had worked include Sony, MTV, Nickeldeon, Paypal and Great Eastern.   Recently he also started an online magazine, Creatives Untold featuring the unusual journey of creative professionals to inspire readers.

Register Here
https://www.eventbrite.sg/e/creative-crew-talks-mar-meeting-2016-tickets-21744532482

events.name: Creative Crew Talks - Mar Meeting 2016
events.description:
An Event for People Who Love to be Inspired 
Creative Crew Singapore is a non-profit organisation devoted to spear the development of the local community for greater learning.  We explore the learning evolution - learn unique experiences with tools or stories to give shape to ideas, and what are the trends that will shape how you'll work and think.  
We hold a series of talks and workshops by some of the brightest minds from design, development, experience and technology. 
  

How Animation & Digital Effects tools powers 3D Visualisations 
This event is free and open to the public. Library books will be available for browsing and borrowing during the event. 
  
 
Programme Details 
Transforming your ideas into engaging visual story have never been easier with 3D and digital media software available today. Two industry professionals, Dion and Ming, will share some valuable insights about how they have achieved this in some of their projects.    This session is particularly interesting to those who are searching for new ways to engage and emotionally connect with your audience.  


There will also be a Q&A session after the talk.‎ 
Speaker Profile 
Dion: Dion, a graduate of the NTU School of Art, Design and Media, is an Art Director and 3D Designer based in Singapore.  He had worked on creative projects with local companies such as CRITICA TV and Abundant Productions before starting his own studio, One Hour Gallery.   Clients that he had worked include Sony, MTV, Nickeldeon, Paypal and Great Eastern.   Recently he also started an online magazine, Creatives Untold featuring the unusual journey of creative professionals to inspire readers. 
Min Yu: Min Yu has worked in the film & video industry for almost 10 years.   He started as a broadcast graphics designer at The Moving Visuals Co. before moving on to companies like Emoxis and Abundant Productions.   Currently, he leads the creative team at Little Red Ants Creative Studio. He has been involved in client works ranging from agency works to channel promos, broadcast titles, tvcs, short films and "run of the mill" corporate videos for both the government and private sector.   He would like to share his work experience on different production processes and workflows. 
  



  


Who should attend? This talk is suitable for anyone who want to learn and meet awesome people. 
Where is the talks held in the Toa Payoh Public Library? We are located at Level 3, Programme Zone 
 
 
  

 
 

Admission Rules 
It's a Free Seating Event. 
Networking with speakers will commence after the event. 
  
Duration: 
Approx 1.5 hrs  
  
Venue: 
6 Toa Payoh Central Singapore 319191 
  
How to get there: Nearest MRT Station : Toa Payoh Nearest Bus Interchange : Toa Payoh Central Buses : SBS Transit 56, 105, 153, 232 via Toa Payoh Central SBS Transit 8, 26, 28, 31, 73, 88, 90, 139, 142, 143, 145, 155, 157, 159,  163, 231, 235, 238 via Toa Payoh Interchange 
  
Like us on Facebook 
  
  
Meet the Sponsor
events.location: Toa Payoh Public Library, Programme Zone, Level 3, 6 Toa Payoh Central, Singapore 319191

events.name: [Workshop] Watson 101 Lab Session: Getting started with Watson Developer Cloud
events.description: The IBM Watson 101 Lab Session is a hands-on experience with IBM Watson. Starting with a set of Watson services, attendees of all skill levels will build several powered by IBM Watson apps with instruction from IBM Watson experts, gaining experience using cognitive technologies. This workshop is perfect for application developers and technical leaders who want to learn how to use next-gen technology to revolutionize products and applications. Pre-requisites:1. Sign up for Bluemix - http://bit.ly/bluemixsg 2. Install NodeJS - http://nodejs.org3. Install Git - http://git-scm.com  NUS Enterprise is our supporting partner and venue sponsor for this event.
events.location: NUS Enterprise@Blk71, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #02-01, Singapore 139951
